00062 void Text::addCharacter (const char &character, const unsigned int &position)
00063 {
00064     if(position > content_.length())
00065         content_.append(1, character);
00066     else
00067     {
00068         if (position < 0)
00069             content_.insert(0, 1, character);
00070         else
00071             content_.insert(position, 1, character);
00072     }
00073     
00074     // Rebuild the appearance rate of every word in text
00075     computeWordRates();
00076 };
00077 
00078 
00087 void Text::addCharacter (const char &character)
00088 {
00089     // Call the generic 'addCharacter' function
00090     addCharacter(character, length());
00091 }

00093 
00103 void Text::removeCharacter (const unsigned int &position)
00104 {
00105     if (position > content_.length())
00106         content_.erase(content_.end());
00107     else
00108     {
00109         if ( position < 0 )
00110             content_.erase(content_.begin());
00111         else
00112             content_.erase(position, 1);
00113     }
00114     
00115     // Rebuild the appearance rate of every word in text
00116     computeWordRates();
00117 };

00139 void Text::content (const string &content)
00140 {

00143     // Rebuild the appearance rate of every word in the new text
00144     computeWordRates();
00145 };

00180 void Text::updateWordRate (const string &word)
00181 {
00182     // Searches the word in the vector
00183     vector<WordRate>::iterator wordRates;
00184     for (wordRates = wordRates_.begin(); wordRates not_eq wordRates_.end(); ++wordRates)
00185     {
00186         // Updates its appearance rate
00187         if ( (*wordRates).first == word )
00188         {
00189             (*wordRates).second++;
00190             return;
00191         }
00192     }
00193     
00194     // The word was not stored, so here we adds its first appearance
00195     wordRates_.push_back(WordRate(word, 1));
00196 };
00197 
00198 
00207 void Text::computeWordRates ()
00208 {   
00209     vector<string> words;   // Vector to hold our words after removing spaces
00210     
00211     // Extract the words in text
00212     tokenize(words);
00213     
00214     // Update appearance rate of every word extracted
00215     vector<string>::iterator wordsIterator;
00216     for (wordsIterator = words.begin(); wordsIterator not_eq words.end(); ++wordsIterator)
00217         updateWordRate(*wordsIterator);
00218         
00219     // This sorting will improve future lookups
00220     sort (wordRates_.begin(), wordRates_.end());
00221 };
00222 
00223 
00231 void Text::tokenize(vector<string>& tokens, const string& delimiters) const
00232 {
00233     // Skip delimiters at the beginning of text
00234     string::size_type lastPos = content_.find_first_not_of(delimiters, 0);
00235     
00236     // Find the first "non-delimiter"
00237     string::size_type pos     = content_.find_first_of(delimiters, lastPos);
00238     
00239     // Traverse the content until reaching its end
00240     while ( (string::npos not_eq pos) or (string::npos not_eq lastPos) )
00241     {
00242         // A word has been found, add it to the vector
00243         tokens.push_back(content_.substr(lastPos, pos - lastPos));
00244         
00245         // Skip delimiters again
00246         lastPos = content_.find_first_not_of(delimiters, pos);
00247         
00248         // Find the next "non-delimiter"
00249         pos = content_.find_first_of(delimiters, lastPos);
00250     }
00251 };
